This is because the rainforest produces 20% of the world's oxygen!

Service

The Secret Service was created in 1865 to combat the increasing problem of counterfeiting in the United States. The first chief of the Secret Service was Lafayette C. Baker, a former Union army intelligence officer. The Secret Service is now a part of the Department of Homeland Security and is responsible for investigating a variety of crimes, including counterfeiting, identity theft, and computer fraud.

The word "wave" is derived from the Old English word wafian, which means "to waver, fluctuate, or move to and fro." A wave is a disturbance that propagates through space and time, usually accompanied by the transfer of energy.

A bicycle, also called a bike, is a two-wheeled vehicle with pedals that you use to ride. You sit on a saddle, and you steer by turning the handlebars. People have been riding bicycles for transportation and recreation for more than 100 years.

Nightmares are actually a form of sleep paralysis, which is when your brain is stuck in the REM state but your body is not.<!!!!>before Christmas

The Nightmare Before Christmas is a 1993 American stop-motion animated musical dark fantasy film directed by Henry Selick, and produced and conceived by Tim Burton. It tells the story of Jack Skellington, a skeleton who lives in Halloweentown who accidentally stumbles upon Christmastown and decides to celebrate the holiday, with some dastardly and comical consequences.
The word "hope" is derived from the Old English word "hopian" which means "to desire, to expect."

The world's tallest mountain is Mount Everest, located in the Mahalangur Himal sub-range of the Himalayas. It has a peak height of 8,848 metres (29,029 ft).<!!!!>The tallest mountain in the solar system is Olympus Mons on Mars. It is about 22 kilometers high.

relief

The American Red Cross provides disaster relief in the United States through a network of more than 650 chapters and 36 blood service regions.<!!!!>relief

After a disaster, people often feel isolated, confused, and helpless. It is important to know that you are not alone and that help is available. There are many organizations that provide disaster relief, and their services are free of charge.

In 1881, the first gymnastics competition was held in the United States.<!!!!>Gymnastics is a sport that requires strength, flexibility, agility, coordination, and balance. The movements involved in gymnastics contribute to the development of the muscles, bones, and joints.

The moon orbits Earth at an average distance of 384,400 kilometers. It takes 27.3 days to orbit Earth, and its orbit is inclined by about 5 degrees to Earth’s orbit around the sun. As a result, eclipses of the sun can only occur when the moon is near one of its two orbital nodes—the points at which the moon’s orbit crosses Earth’s orbit around the sun.
When the Roman Empire fell, many circus performers were out of work. So, they took their skills to the streets and became beggars.
